creator: ytaylor@qcorps.com
text:
From apache documentation, tomcat 4.0.b5 can work with apache1.3.12. 
This is what they say: 
      1) download apr pacakage 
      2) build apr package. 
      3) build tomcat/src/connectors. That produces mod_webapp.so. 
      4) copy mod_webapp.so under apache/libexec 
      5) Add LoadModule webapp_module libexec/mod_webapp.so in
         httpd.conf file of apache 
      6) Start apache 

I did all the above, and everything was successful except step 6. When
I type ./apachectl start, I got this message: 

Syntax error line x (where x is the line number where LoadModule exists).
Invalid command 'Load Module' , perhaps mis-spelled or
defined by a module not included in server configuration. 

I tried doing the exact same thing with apache 1.3.20, and now at step
6, I get this error: 
Cannot load /usr/local/apache_1.3.20/libexec/mod_webapp.so into
server: undefined symbol: ap_ctx_get ./apachectl start: httpd could not be
started. 

I would appreciate your input to see if tomcat 4.0.b5 works with apache
1.3.x. 

Thanks, Yadira

creator: pier@betaversion.org
text:
I believe you're using a version of Apache compiled with shared code. 
Can you try with the sources associated with Tomcat 4.0 beta 7?

I didn't receive any feedback... I believe this can be closed as it 
"works 4 me"
creator: pier@betaversion.org
